problem: Mrs. Smith invests 2000 dollars in an account that compounds annually at a constant interest rate. After five years, her investment has grown to 3220 dollars. What is the annual interest rate, as a percentage? (Round your answer to the nearest integer.)
solution: Let $r$ be the annual interest rate. Then after five years, Mrs. Smith's investment is $2000 \cdot \left( 1 + \frac{r}{100} \right)^5$, so \[2000 \cdot \left( 1 + \frac{r}{100} \right)^5 = 3220.\] Then \[\left( 1 + \frac{r}{100} \right)^5 = 1.61,\] so \[1 + \frac{r}{100} = \sqrt[5]{1.61} = 1.09854,\] which means $r = \boxed{10}$, to the nearest integer.
